In the region of Västra Götaland, from 17 February, disposable masks have to be worn on public transport at all times, not just during rush hours, as well as in situations where close contact, e.g. for extended periods of time in an indoor environment, is unavoidable.  Although this is still a mere recommendation, it is a much stronger one than the mask recommendation elsewhere in the country (limited to rush hours on public transport), so I have coded it as 2T to reflect the policy change as a result of which in practice, in this region, people will be wearing masks much more often than before.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210217212115/https://www.vgregion.se/aktuellt/nyhetslista/nya-regionala-rekommendationer-i-vastra-gotaland/  ***Updated to add note that policy language seems stronger than a recommendation

On 17 February, the government proposed five new measures under the Pandemic Law, which are likely to come into force on 11 March:  1) Giving the govt the power to, if needed, close down more businesses in addition to shops and shopping centres alone:   • All retail locations (shops, shopping centres and department stores) though there would be exceptions for essential businesses like supermarkets and pharmacies  • Service locations where it is difficult to keep a distance, such as hairdressers and massage salons  • Gyms, swimming pools and other sports facilities  • Restaurants, with an exception for takeaway food  • Venues for private events   2) Giving municipalities the power to limit entry to public places where there is a risk of crowding  3) Closure of theme and amusement parks as well as zoos  4) Limit the numbers of visitors to museums and art galleries to no more than one per ten square metres of usable space  5) New system for public gatherings and events, meaning that different limits would apply to the following kinds of events, based on the risk of infection:  • Indoor events  • Indoor events with designated seating  • Outdoor events  • Races and similar sporting competitions  https://web.archive.org/web/20210219202356/https://www.thelocal.se/20210217/explained-the-five-new-coronavirus-measures-announced-by-sweden

No change, but the government is preparing new measures as listed in the M1 note for 17 Feb, likely to come into force on 11 March.     Most workplaces can open with special measures in place, but a number of workplaces are forced to close in relation to the ban on public gatherings of over 8 people, such as fairground amusements and parades, and markets and fairs.     Shops, gyms, indoor sports facilities, and swimming facilities must calculate the number of visitors so that each person is given ten square meters of space. The companies must display clear signage that clarifies for visitors how many people may visit the premises at the same time.       Restaurants, cafés and pubs can open, but the size of a dining party allowed to sit at one table is limited to four people. If a party is larger than eight people, they must be divided between several tables with at least one metre between them. The serving of alcoholic beverages is prohibited between 20.00 and 11.00.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210226201447/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/restriktioner-och-forbud

No change: public events have to be cancelled because of the ban on gatherings over 8 people.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210226201447/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/restriktioner-och-forbud

No change:   Until further notice, no more than eight people may be present at a public gathering or public event. The police has the right to cancel or dissolve an event that has more than eight attendees.  If a private gathering is held at an event venue, in a meeting room and at other rented premises, a maximum of eight people are allowed to attend.  An exception is made for funerals, where up to 20 participants are allowed.  If you organise an event in violation of the ban, you may face a fine or prison sentence of up to six months.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210226201447/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/restriktioner-och-forbud

No change: coded as 1 to reflect the recommendations 1) to the public to limit the use of public transport as much as possible; 2) to public transport providers to alter their services in a way that limits the spread of the virus.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210226201805/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/skydda-dig-och-andra/om-du-planerar-att-resa/i-kollektivtrafiken/

No change: the federal government's recommendations include to stay home if you have symptoms and work from home if you can.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210226201447/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/restriktioner-och-forbud

Several regions have issued a recommendation to avoid unnecessary travel within the region and to other parts of Sweden. These include Stockholm, Sörmland, Uppsala, Värmland, Västmanland, Västra Götaland.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210226195551/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/regional-information-about-coronavirus    The nation-wide recommendation for in-country travel is still:   You have the personal responsibility to travel in a way that minimizes the spread of infection. ... Keep in mind that the spread of covid-19 is difficult to predict and can change in the place you travel to. Therefore, local restrictions may be imposed at short notice. It can affect your ability to travel home. If you need to stay away longer than planned, you may need to arrange accommodation during the extended stay and transport home.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210226203049/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/skydda-dig-och-andra/om-du-planerar-att-resa/

No change: non-essential travel to Sweden from countries outside the EU is banned until March 31; temporary ban on entry to Sweden for nationals from the UK, Denmark and Norway (with exceptions); all foreign nationals need to present a negative Covid-19 test result no older than 48h in order to travel into Sweden.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210226203503/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/travel-restrictions    Several EU embassies have asked Sweden for more leniency towards European travellers, as Swedish border officials' interpretation of the rules would be overly strict:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210226203623/https://www.thelocal.se/20210226/eu-embassies-ask-sweden-for-more-lenience-towards-european-travellers

No change:  Short-time working means that an employee reduces working hours and wages instead of being laid off. This means that employers can reduce employees' working hours and receive financial support from the Government to compensate for a significant part of the costs for retaining the employee. ... The government extends support for short-time working until June 2021. ... The support for short-time work allowance has been extended and the working hours can be reduced up to 80% for the months: May, June and July.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210226204506/https://www.verksamt.se/web/international/running/gathered-information-to-entrepreneurs-due-to-the-corona-virus/for-employers

No change:   "The temporary additional payment for families with housing allowance has ceased. The last payments to families were made in December 2020."    There are numerous other policies, but these are for companies (some also employee-oriented), but not households.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210226204452/https://www.forsakringskassan.se/english/the-coronavirus-covid-19---applicable-regulations

The Public Health Agency recommends everyone over 6 years old gets tested if they have symptoms. In addition, people who have travelled to Sweden from abroad can get tested.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210226205505/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/the-public-health-agency-of-sweden/communicable-disease-control/covid-19/covid-19-testing/

No change:   The treating physician or other health care personnel with special competence perform the infection tracking. The person with covid-19 is contacted and has to answer questions about who they have met and where they have been since the first signs of symptoms and 48 hours before. ... In the next step, contact is made with those who may have been exposed to infection. This is done either by the infected person himself, in dialogue with an infection tracker, or by an infection tracker in the responsible region. Anyone who is contacted in an infection tracker receives information about what this means and what measures may need to be taken.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210226205613/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/testning-och-smittsparning/smittsparning/

A,C:  Phase 1: The first group to be offered vaccination will be those living in nursing homes or receiving home care, members of the same household and staff who work with them. Phase 2: Next, vaccination will be offered to those 65 years old and above. This includes adults receiving LSS interventions or assistance allowance, healthcare and care service personnel, people who have undergone bone marrow or other organ transplantation and people undergoing dialysis treatment. https://web.archive.org/web/20210226205411/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/vaccination-against-covid-19/when-is-it-my-turn  The vaccinations are carried out by the regions, so the phase of the vaccination programme can differ from region to region. Currently, some regions are in phase 1 and some in phase 2:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210226195551/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/regional-information-about-coronavirus  Type of vaccine: Pfizer, Moderna, AstraZeneca  https://web.archive.org/web/20210219214611/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/nyheter-och-press/nyhetsarkiv/2021/januari/tredje-vaccinet-mot-covid-19-har-godkants  Vaccinations still taking place: https://archive.is/YCPH4 ***Updated to add working link

The Public Health Agency assesses that people living in elderly homes who have been vaccinated with two doses can return to a slightly more normal life when it comes to contacts with other people, two weeks after the second dose. Infections and deaths have decreased among people living in elderly homes, as the proportion who have been vaccinated against covid-19 has increased. This opens up the possibility for the residents to meet relatives again closely in their own home, and to avoid decisions on restraining orders.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210226205825/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/nyheter-och-press/nyhetsarkiv/2021/februari/skyddet-av-vaccin-mot-covid-19-oppnar-for-vissa-lattnader-for-de-aldsta/    However, for the time being, there are still visiting bans in place in several municipalities, most until 28 February and one until 9 March, listed here: https://web.archive.org/web/20210226210115/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/information-till-varden/personal-inom-aldreomsorg/lokala-besoksforbud-pa-aldreboenden/lista-pa-kommuner/

Several more regions have introduced more extensive mask recommendations: the use of masks on public transport at all times, not only during rush hours, and when there is prolonged (15+ min) close contact with other people indoors. This concerns the following regions: Gävleborg, Halland, Stockholm, Sörmland, Uppsala, Västerbotten, Västra Götaland.   Although these are still mere recommendation, they are much stronger than the federal government's mask recommendation which is limited to rush hours on public transport, so I have coded it as 2T to reflect the policy change as a result of which in practice, in these regions, people will be wearing masks much more often than before.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210226195551/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/regional-information-about-coronavirus  ***Updated to add note confirming that policy language seems stronger than a recommendation, e.g. "must wear"

At the federal level, the Public Health Agency recommends that, for the period of 25 Jan-1 April, upper secondary schools (gymnasieskolor) conduct their education partially as distance education and partially at school. Whether to switch to distance learning depends on infection rates.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210226195119/https://www.skolverket.se/regler-och-ansvar/coronaviruset-och-covid-19---regler-for-skolor-och-forskolor/coronaviruset---fragor-och-svar-utifran-skollagstiftningen    At the regional level, therefore, on 25 February, several regional 'Infection Control Units' (Smittskyd) recommended to switch distance learning entirely for the senior level of compulsory school (högstadieskolor) and upper-secondary schools (gymnasieskolor). This concerns in the regions of Halland, Kalmar, Kronoberg, Skåne, Stockholm, Skellefteå, Västmanland and Västra Götaland, where infection rates are rising.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210226195551/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/regional-information-about-coronavirus

Additionally:   On 26 February, the Public Health Agency decided that from 1 March, restaurants will need to close at 20.30. This applies regardless of whether alcohol is served or not. Take-away remains possible.     The Public Health Agency maintains a dialogue with the business community about further limiting the number of visitors to shops and malls and about infection control measures at workplaces. The Swedish Public Health Agency is also working to tighten the rules for sports.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210226211107/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/nyheter-och-press/nyhetsarkiv/2021/februari/fler-atgarder-for-att-minska-smittspridningen/

Several regions have introduced more extensive mask recommendations: the use of masks on public transport at all times, not only during rush hours, and when there is prolonged (15+ min) close contact with other people indoors.      Although these are technically recommendations, they are much stronger than the federal government's mask recommendation which is limited to rush hours on public transport, so I have coded it as 2T to reflect the policy change as a result of which in practice, in these regions, people will be wearing masks much more often than before. The wording of the recommendation is strong, e.g. for Stockholm: "Monouse masks must always be worn in public transport and indoor environments where there is prolonged contact with other people."    http://web.archive.org/web/20210308153242/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/regional-information-about-coronavirus

There is still 1 municipality with a visiting ban in place for elderly homes.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210308224020/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/information-till-varden/personal-inom-aldreomsorg/lokala-besoksforbud-pa-aldreboenden/    The general recommendations for visitors of elderly homes include:   - Do not visit if you have symptoms of covid-19, even mild symptoms.  - Before the visit - talk to the staff about what applies to the specific nursing home.  - During the visit - wash your hands, and even if the person you are visiting is vaccinated, you need to keep your distance from other residents, and also from the staff.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210308224233/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/fragor-och-svar/?exp=80974

New rules bring stricter policies into place on businesses, particularly restaurants and cafes. From Monday, March 1:     -"Under the new rules put forward by the Public Health Agency last week, only one person should be served in restaurants and cafés that do not have their own entrances.  This means that you should eat alone at restaurants located in, for example, shopping centres and larger department stores, where the entrances are shared within another space."     -"All customers at restaurants and cafés should keep at least one metre apart from each other."     -"All restaurants and cafés in Sweden have to close at 8.30pm and may not open until 5am the next morning."     https://archive.is/PxBGb#selection-2201.61-2201.225

New rules on sports come into place from Monday, March 1. "no competitive sport below elite level will be allowed to take place. This includes single matches for children born in 2005 or later, which were previously exempt."     https://archive.is/PxBGb#selection-2201.61-2201.225

New rules on sports come into place from Monday, March 1. "no competitive sport below elite level will be allowed to take place. This includes single matches for children born in 2005 or later, which were previously exempt."     https://archive.is/PxBGb#selection-2201.61-2201.225

***Recoded from 3G to 2G. As these measures are in place regionally, there is no evidence that at the national level all three groups are being vaccinated. Rather, two groups seems more accurate at the naional level as an average.     Previous coding note:   A,B,C:   Phase 1: The first group to be offered vaccination will be those living in nursing homes or receiving home care, members of the same household and staff who work with them.  Phase 2: Next, vaccination will be offered to those 65 years old and above. This includes adults receiving LSS interventions or assistance allowance, healthcare and care service personnel, people who have undergone bone marrow or other organ transplantation and people undergoing dialysis treatment.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210226205411/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/vaccination-against-covid-19/when-is-it-my-turn    The vaccinations are carried out by the regions, so the phase of the vaccination programme can differ from region to region. Some regions are still at the stage of vaccinating only people in nursing homes, some regions vaccinate 80+, some 70+, some 65+. From 2 March onwards, several regions have started announcing that they are in phase 2, which includes a few clinically vulnerable groups: adults receiving LSS interventions or assistance allowance, healthcare and care service personnel, people who have undergone bone marrow or other organ transplantation and people undergoing dialysis treatment.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210308222627/https://www.krisinformation.se/detta-kan-handa/handelser-och-storningar/20192/myndigheterna-om-det-nya-coronaviruset/regional-information-om-coronaviruset    Type of vaccine: Pfizer, Moderna, AstraZeneca   https://web.archive.org/web/20210219214611/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/nyheter-och-press/nyhetsarkiv/2021/januari/tredje-vaccinet-mot-covid-19-har-godkants    Vaccinations are still taking place: https://web.archive.org/web/20210308223138/https://www.thelocal.se/20210129/charts-how-is-swedens-vaccination-programme-going/

On 6 March, a large demonstration against the tightening of the covid measures was held in Stockholm, with reportedly hundreds of people from different parts of the country participating, despite the ban on gatherings of over 8 and the recommendation against internal travel. The protest was triggered by the PM's announcement that Sweden might be heading in the direction of its first lockdown.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210308224820/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-sweden-demonstrati/swedish-police-break-up-coronavirus-demonstration-in-stockholm-idUSKBN2AY0LE

Whether to switch to distance learning depends on infection rates. http://web.archive.org/web/20210311191243/https://www.skolverket.se/regler-och-ansvar/coronaviruset-och-covid-19---regler-for-skolor-och-forskolor/coronaviruset---fragor-och-svar-utifran-skollagstiftningen    At the regional level, therefore, several regional 'Infection Control Units' (Smittskyd) have recommended to switch distance learning entirely for the senior level of compulsory school (högstadieskolor) and upper-secondary schools (gymnasieskolor). This concerns in the regions of Gävleborg, Halland, Kalmar, Kronoberg, Skåne, Stockholm, Skellefteå, Västmanland and Västra Götaland.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210311191515/https://www.krisinformation.se/detta-kan-handa/handelser-och-storningar/20192/myndigheterna-om-det-nya-coronaviruset/regional-information-om-coronaviruset

Most workplaces can open with special measures in place, but a number of workplaces are forced to close in relation to the ban on public gatherings of over 8 people, such as fairground amusements and parades, and markets and fairs.     Restaurants and cafés must be closed for consumption on site between 20.30 and 05.00. The size of a dining party allowed to sit at one table is limited to four people. If a party is larger than eight people, they must be divided between several tables with at least one metre between them.    Shops, gym and sports facilities must calculate the number of visitors so that each person gets at least 10m². The maximum number of visitors is 500. They must have clear signs about how many are allowed to stay in the room at the same time. Department stores and shops must take appropriate measures for people to visit the business one by one, without company.   Shopping centres are an exception because they may house workplaces, care facilities and public transport services that cannot be accessed in any other way.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210311194528/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/restriktioner-och-forbud    http://web.archive.org/web/20210312090016/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/verksamheter/tillsynsvagledning-gallande-restauranger-och-krogar/    http://web.archive.org/web/20210312090222/https://www.krisinformation.se/detta-kan-handa/handelser-och-storningar/20192/myndigheterna-om-det-nya-coronaviruset/coronapandemin-detta-galler-just-nu    http://web.archive.org/web/20210312090534/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/news/2021/mars/limited-number-of-visitors-to-stores-shops-swimming-centres-gyms-and-sports-facilities

No change:     The government has introduced a number of restrictions in connection with the pandemic law.    Until further notice, no more than eight people may be present at a public gathering or public event. The police has the right to cancel or dissolve an event that has more than eight attendees.    If a private gathering is held at an event venue, in a meeting room and at other rented premises, a maximum of eight people are allowed to attend. An exception is made for funerals, where up to 20 participants are allowed.     If you organise an event in violation of the ban, you may face a fine or prison sentence of up to six months.    Shops, gyms, indoor sports facilities, and swimming facilities must calculate the number of visitors so that each person is given ten square meters of space. The companies must display clear signage that clarifies for visitors how many people may visit the premises at the same time.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210311194528/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/restriktioner-och-forbud

No change: coded as 1 to reflect the recommendations 1) to the public to limit the use of public transport as much as possible; 2) to public transport providers to alter their services in a way that limits the spread of the virus. http://web.archive.org/web/20210311192945/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/skydda-dig-och-andra/om-du-planerar-att-resa/i-kollektivtrafiken/     Some regional recommendations also specifically mention public transport, such as Västmanland: 'Avoid public transport, shopping centres, and other situations where crowding may occur.' http://web.archive.org/web/20210311191515/https://www.krisinformation.se/detta-kan-handa/handelser-och-storningar/20192/myndigheterna-om-det-nya-coronaviruset/regional-information-om-coronaviruset

No change: the federal government's recommendations include to stay home if you have symptoms and work from home if you can.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210311193502/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/national-regulations

The nation-wide recommendation for in-country travel is still:   You have the personal responsibility to travel in a way that minimizes the spread of infection. ... Keep in mind that the spread of covid-19 is difficult to predict and can change in the place you travel to. Therefore, local restrictions may be imposed at short notice. It can affect your ability to travel home. If you need to stay away longer than planned, you may need to arrange accommodation during the extended stay and transport home.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210312193502/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/skydda-dig-och-andra/om-du-planerar-att-resa/    Several regions have issued a recommendation to avoid unnecessary travel within the region/county and to other parts of Sweden. These currently include:   Stockholm: http://web.archive.org/web/20210312193741/https://www.sll.se/verksamhet/halsa-och-vard/nyheter-halsa-och-vard/2021/02/nya-regionala-rekommendationer/  Sörmland: http://web.archive.org/web/20210312193517/https://regionsormland.se/nyheter/nyhetslista/nya-skarpta-regionala-rekommendationer-i-sormland/  Uppsala: http://web.archive.org/web/20210312193755/https://via.tt.se/pressmeddelande/region-uppsala-utokar-rekommendationer-och-okar-provtagning-for-att-forebygga-tredje-vag?publisherId=3235664&releaseId=3293693  Västerbotten: http://web.archive.org/web/20210312193918/https://www.regionvasterbotten.se/sarskilda-rekommendationer-i-vasterbotten  Västmanland: http://web.archive.org/web/20210312193829/https://newsroom.notified.com/region-vastmanland/posts/pressreleases/region-vastmanland-infor-nya-restriktioner-fo

No change: non-essential travel to Sweden from countries outside the EU is banned until March 31; temporary ban on entry to Sweden for nationals from the UK, Denmark and Norway (with exceptions); all foreign nationals need to present a negative Covid-19 test result no older than 48h in order to travel into Sweden.     In addition, the following recommendation applies to everyone, including Swedes:   The Public Health Agency recommends everyone who travels into Sweden , regardless of citizenship, to test themselves upon entry and to avoid contacts for seven days. Five days after arriving from abroad, the traveler should take a second test. This applies regardless of whether you are covered by the requirement to present a negative covid-19 test before entry.  Stay home for at least seven days.  Avoid contact with others as much as possible.  Test yourself as soon as possible after arrival in Sweden with a follow-up test after five days.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210312194210/https://www.krisinformation.se/detta-kan-handa/handelser-och-storningar/20192/myndigheterna-om-det-nya-coronaviruset/reseinformation-med-anledning-av-det-nya-coronaviruset

No change:  Short-time working means that an employee reduces working hours and wages instead of being laid off. This means that employers can reduce employees' working hours and receive financial support from the Government to compensate for a significant part of the costs for retaining the employee. ... The government extends support for short-time working until June 2021. ... The support for short-time work allowance has been extended and the working hours can be reduced up to 80% for the months: May, June and July.     The government has decided to temporarily suspend the deduction from sick pay for the qualifying period from 11 March 2020 to 30 April 2021.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210312194533/https://www.verksamt.se/web/international/running/gathered-information-to-entrepreneurs-due-to-the-corona-virus/for-employers
No change: http://web.archive.org/web/20210312194859/https://www.forsakringskassan.se/english/the-coronavirus-covid-19---applicable-regulations
See e.g. http://web.archive.org/web/20210312195004/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/fragor-och-svar/

No change: testing is recommended to anyone over 6 years old with symptoms + recommended to people who have travelled from abroad.    If you have previously had COVID-19 in the past half-year and this was confirmed through a PCR test, an antigen test or an antibody test, you do not need to be retested for COVID-19, unless a doctor determines that you need to do so. However, you should stay at home as long as you have symptoms.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210312195310/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/the-public-health-agency-of-sweden/communicable-disease-control/covid-19/covid-19-testing/  http://web.archive.org/web/20210312194210/https://www.krisinformation.se/detta-kan-handa/handelser-och-storningar/20192/myndigheterna-om-det-nya-coronaviruset/reseinformation-med-anledning-av-det-nya-coronaviruset
No change: http://web.archive.org/web/20210312195326/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/testning-och-smittsparning/smittsparning/

No change: several regions have introduced more extensive mask recommendations: the use of masks on public transport at all times, not only during rush hours, and when there is prolonged (15+ min) close contact with other people indoors.      This is coded as 2T to reflect the broader scope of application and stronger language ("must always be worn") of this recommendation compared to the national-level recommendation for rush hour mask use in public transport.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210308153242/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/regional-information-about-coronavirus    However, important to note is that compliance with the recommendation appears to be limited. According to a Dutch newspaper's Sweden correspondent, many people do not wear masks on public transport in Stockholm, while the recommendation for region Stockholm is one of the most strongly worded ones compared to the rest of the country: http://web.archive.org/web/20210312195107/https://myprivacy.dpgmedia.nl/consent?siteKey=PUBX2BuuZfEPJ6vF&callbackUrl=https%3a%2f%2fwww.volkskrant.nl%2fprivacy-wall%2faccept%3fredirectUri%3d%252fkijkverder%252fv%252f2021%252fhet-land-van-pippi-nationalisme-zoekt-zondebok%257ev426968%252f

***Updated to further explain code shift - Överkalix municipality had a ban on visits from 24 February 2021 to 9 March 2021. Ban is up so switch from 3T to 2G https://web.archive.org/web/20210226210115/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/information-till-varden/personal-inom-aldreomsorg/lokala-besoksforbud-pa-aldreboenden/lista-pa-kommuner/  The general recommendations for visitors of elderly homes include:  - Do not visit if you have symptoms of covid-19, even mild symptoms. - Before the visit - talk to the staff about what applies to the specific nursing home. - During the visit - wash your hands, and even if the person you are visiting is vaccinated, you need to keep your distance from other residents, and also from the staff. http://web.archive.org/web/20210312201038/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/publicerat-material/publikationsarkiv/f/forebygg-smittspridning-av-covid-19-vid-besok-pa-sarskilda-boenden-for-aldre/

***Recoded from 3G to 2G. As these measures are in place regionally, there is no evidence that at the national level all three groups are being vaccinated. Rather, two groups seems more accurate at the naional level as an average.     A,B,C:   Several regions are now in Phase 2, which includes anyone 65+ (though implementation differs from region to region) as well as a few clinically vulnerable groups: adults receiving LSS interventions or assistance allowance, healthcare and care service personnel, people who have undergone bone marrow or other organ transplantation and people undergoing dialysis treatment.  Information on which groups are included the different phases of the vaccination strategy: http://web.archive.org/web/20210311193915/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/vaccination-against-covid-19/when-is-it-my-turn  Information on stages of vaccination campaign in different regions: http://web.archive.org/web/20210311191515/https://www.krisinformation.se/detta-kan-handa/handelser-och-storningar/20192/myndigheterna-om-det-nya-coronaviruset/regional-information-om-coronaviruset    Type of vaccine: Pfizer, Moderna, AstraZeneca https://web.archive.org/web/20210219214611/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/nyheter-och-press/nyhetsarkiv/2021/januari/tredje-vaccinet-mot-covid-19-har-godkants    The Janssen vaccin was approved on 11 March, but delivery to Sweden is expected only next month:  http://web.archive.org/web/20210311192846/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/nyheter-och-press/nyhetsarkiv/2021/mars/fjarde-vaccinet-mot-covid-19-godkant/     Vaccinations are still taking place: http://web.archive.org/web/20210311194318/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/vaccination-mot-covid-19/statistik/statistik-over-registrerade-vaccinationer-covid-19/

At the federal level, the Public Health Agency recommends that, for the period of 25 Jan-1 April, upper secondary schools (gymnasieskolor) conduct their education partially as distance education and partially at school. Whether to switch to distance learning depends on infection rates.     This decision is at the discretion of the school principal, who has a certain flexibility to make decisions about their activities based on the current infection control situation or local needs, which is why this is coded with a Targeted flag.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210318185946/https://www.skolverket.se/regler-och-ansvar/coronaviruset-och-covid-19---regler-for-skolor-och-forskolor/coronaviruset---fragor-och-svar-utifran-skollagstiftningen    At the regional level, several regional 'Infection Control Units' (Smittskyd) have made more specific recommendations to schools, such as:   - To switch distance learning entirely for the senior level of compulsory school (högstadieskolor) and upper-secondary schools (gymnasieskolor) in Stockholm: https://web.archive.org/web/20210319183430/https://www.sll.se/verksamhet/halsa-och-vard/nyheter-halsa-och-vard/2021/02/nya-regionala-rekommendationer/   - To only allow 1/3 of students at a time in gymnasieskolor in Västra Götaland: http://web.archive.org/web/20210319183251/https://vgrfokus.se/2021/03/covid-19-fortsatt-hogt-tryck-pa-varden-skarpta-rad-forlangs/

No change:     Most workplaces can open with special measures in place, but a number of workplaces are forced to close in relation to the ban on public gatherings of over 8 people, such as fairground amusements and parades, and markets and fairs.     Restaurants and cafés must be closed for consumption on site between 20.30 and 05.00. The size of a dining party allowed to sit at one table is limited to 4 people. If a party is larger than 8 people, they must be divided between several tables with at least one metre between them. Shops, gym and sports facilities must calculate the number of visitors so that each person gets at least 10m². The maximum number of visitors is 500. They must have clear signs about how many are allowed to stay in the room at the same time.     Department stores and shops must take appropriate measures for people to visit the business one by one, without company. Shopping centres are an exception because they may house workplaces, care facilities and public transport services that cannot be accessed in any other way.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210319183959/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/restriktioner-och-forbud    http://web.archive.org/web/20210319184121/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/verksamheter/tillsynsvagledning-gallande-restauranger-och-krogar/    http://web.archive.org/web/20210319184226/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/news/2021/mars/limited-number-of-visitors-to-stores-shops-swimming-centres-gyms-and-sports-facilities    http://web.archive.org/web/20210319184416/https://www.krisinformation.se/detta-kan-handa/handelser-och-storningar/20192/myndigheterna-om-det-nya-coronaviruset/coronapandemin-detta-galler-just-nu

No change:   The government has introduced a number of restrictions in connection with the pandemic law. Until further notice, no more than 8 people may be present at a public gathering or public event. The police has the right to cancel or dissolve an event that has more than 8 attendees.   If a private gathering is held at an event venue, in a meeting room and at other rented premises, a maximum of eight people are allowed to attend. An exception is made for funerals, where up to 20 participants are allowed. If you organise an event in violation of the ban, you may face a fine or prison sentence of up to six months.   Shops, gyms, indoor sports facilities, and swimming facilities must calculate the number of visitors so that each person is given ten square meters of space. The companies must display clear signage that clarifies for visitors how many people may visit the premises at the same time.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210326151033/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/restriktioner-och-forbud

No change: coded as 1 to reflect the recommendations 1) to the public to limit the use of public transport and forms of transport where you cannot book a designated seat as much as possible; 2) to public transport providers to alter their services in a way that limits the spread of the virus.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210326151421/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/skydda-dig-och-andra/om-du-planerar-att-resa/i-kollektivtrafiken/

No change: the federal government's recommendations include to stay home if you have symptoms and work from home if you can.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210326151604/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/national-regulations

The nation-wide recommendation for in-country travel is still: You have the personal responsibility to travel in a way that minimizes the spread of infection. ... Keep in mind that the spread of covid-19 is difficult to predict and can change in the place you travel to. Therefore, local restrictions may be imposed at short notice. It can affect your ability to travel home. If you need to stay away longer than planned, you may need to arrange accommodation during the extended stay and transport home. http://web.archive.org/web/20210326151740/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/skydda-dig-och-andra/om-du-planerar-att-resa/    In several regions, stricter regional measures (still recommendations) dictate to "avoid all unnecessary travel to, from and within the region". This applies to Stockholm, Södermanland, Uppsala, Västerbotten, Västmanland, Västra Götaland: http://web.archive.org/web/20210326111303/https://www.thelocal.se/20210226/which-swedish-regions-have-stricter-coronavirus-measures-in-place/

No change: non-essential travel to Sweden from countries outside the EU is banned until March 31; temporary ban on entry to Sweden for nationals from the UK, Denmark and Norway (with exceptions); all foreign nationals need to present a negative Covid-19 test result no older than 48h in order to travel into Sweden.     In addition, the following recommendation applies to everyone, including Swedes:   The Public Health Agency recommends everyone who travels into Sweden , regardless of citizenship, to test themselves upon entry and to avoid contacts for seven days. Five days after arriving from abroad, the traveler should take a second test. This applies regardless of whether you are covered by the requirement to present a negative covid-19 test before entry. Stay home for at least seven days. Avoid contact with others as much as possible. Test yourself as soon as possible after arrival in Sweden with a follow-up test after five days.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210326151919/https://www.krisinformation.se/detta-kan-handa/handelser-och-storningar/20192/myndigheterna-om-det-nya-coronaviruset/reseinformation-med-anledning-av-det-nya-coronaviruset

No change, measures in place until June 2021:   Short-time working means that an employee reduces working hours and wages instead of being laid off. This means that employers can reduce employees' working hours and receive financial support from the Government to compensate for a significant part of the costs for retaining the employee. ... The government extends support for short-time working until June 2021. ... The support for short-time work allowance has been extended and the working hours can be reduced up to 80% for the months: May, June and July. The government has decided to temporarily suspend the deduction from sick pay for the qualifying period from 11 March 2020 to 30 April 2021.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210326152028/https://www.verksamt.se/web/international/running/gathered-information-to-entrepreneurs-due-to-the-corona-virus/for-employers
No change: http://web.archive.org/web/20210326152142/https://www.forsakringskassan.se/english/the-coronavirus-covid-19---applicable-regulations
See e.g.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210326152232/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/fragor-och-svar/

Testing is recommended to anyone over 6 years old with symptoms + recommended to people who have travelled from abroad. If you have previously had COVID-19 in the past half-year and this was confirmed through a PCR test, an antigen test or an antibody test, you do not need to be retested for COVID-19, unless a doctor determines that you need to do so. However, you should stay at home as long as you have symptoms.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210326152327/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/the-public-health-agency-of-sweden/communicable-disease-control/covid-19/covid-19-testing/    http://web.archive.org/web/20210326151919/https://www.krisinformation.se/detta-kan-handa/handelser-och-storningar/20192/myndigheterna-om-det-nya-coronaviruset/reseinformation-med-anledning-av-det-nya-coronaviruset    The government’s new test strategy suggests that in the future, large-scale testing (incl for asymptomatic people) may become available: http://web.archive.org/web/20210326110159/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/nyheter-och-press/nyhetsarkiv/2021/mars/ny-teststrategi-ska-starka-smittskyddsarbetet/
No change:  http://web.archive.org/web/20210326152440/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/testning-och-smittsparning/smittsparning/

No change:   The regions of Gävleborg, Halland, Norrbotten, Stockholm, Södermanland, Uppsala, Västerbotten, Västmanland, and Västra Götaland have introduced more extensive mask recommendations: the use of masks on public transport at all times, not only during rush hours, and when there is prolonged (15+ min) close contact with other people indoors.   This is coded as 2T to reflect the broader scope of application and stronger language ("must always be worn") of this recommendation compared to the national-level recommendation for rush hour mask use in public transport.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210326111303/https://www.thelocal.se/20210226/which-swedish-regions-have-stricter-coronavirus-measures-in-place/

The general recommendations for visitors of elderly homes include:   - Stay at home if you feel ill. Cancel the visit even in case of mild symptoms.   - Wash your hands before, during and after the visit.   - Even if the person you are visiting has been vaccinated, you need to keep your distance from other people during the visit, both indoors and outdoors.   - There are local procedures for visits. Ask the staff about the procedures that apply at the care home you are visiting.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210326105242/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/publicerat-material/publikationsarkiv/p/prevent-the-spread-of-covid-19-when-visiting-care-homes-for-older-people/

At the federal level, the Public Health Agency recommends that, for the period of 25 Jan-1 April, upper secondary schools (gymnasieskolor) conduct their education partially as distance education and partially at school. Whether to switch to distance learning depends on infection rates. This decision is at the discretion of the school principal, who has a certain flexibility to make decisions about their activities based on the current infection control situation or local needs, which is why this is coded with a Targeted flag.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210401164149/https://www.skolverket.se/regler-och-ansvar/coronaviruset-och-covid-19---regler-for-skolor-och-forskolor/coronaviruset---fragor-och-svar-utifran-skollagstiftningen    The policy language allows for complete closure, but it is unclear to what extent any gymnasieskolor are actually fully closed. The only indication I could find was reference to fully closed gymnasieskolor in newspaper reporting, e.g.: http://web.archive.org/web/20210419183926/https://www.hd.se/2021-01-26/stangd-gymnasieskola-i-angelholm-har-digitalt-oppet-hus    At the regional level, several regional 'Infection Control Units' (Smittskyd) have made more specific recommendations to schools, such as:   - To only allow 1/3 of students at a time in gymnasieskolor in Västra Götaland: http://web.archive.org/web/20210401164203/https://alfresco.vgregion.se/alfresco/service/vgr/storage/node/content/workspace/SpacesStore/a98c8c64-a09b-487a-9b6d-824273810afc/2%20-%20Regionala%20rek%20%C3%B6vers%C3%A4ttningar%20-%20Engelska%20A4%20%28Vecka%2011%29.pdf?a=false&guest=true

**Changed back to 2G after incorrect interpretation of new rules for amusement parks by other coder. The new rules do not allow amusement parks to reopen. Currently, 'permanent amusement parks' ('stadigvarande tivolinöje') are not covered by the new rules (re maximum numbers of visitors), as they are deemed a 'public event' under ch 3, s 1 of the Restriction Regulation (begränsningsförordningen), i.e. the 8-people gathering limit.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210401150004/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/verksamheter/tillsynsvagledning-for-verksamheter/  (under the heading "Nöjesparker, djurparker, temaparker eller andra liknande anläggningar")

A,C:   Most regions are still in Phase 1: "Phase 1: The first group to be offered vaccination will be those living in nursing homes or receiving home care, members of the same household and staff who work with them." Several regions have entered Phase 2, which includes anyone 65+ (though implementation differs from region to region) as well as a few clinically vulnerable groups (B): adults receiving LSS interventions or assistance allowance, healthcare and care service personnel, people who have undergone bone marrow or other organ transplantation and people undergoing dialysis treatment. Information on which groups are included the different phases of the vaccination strategy.   The Public Health Agency has announced that the elderly should be clearly prioritized over the younger: http://web.archive.org/web/20210326110350/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/nyheter-och-press/nyhetsarkiv/2021/mars/skarpt-prioritering-av-aldre-vid-vaccination/     Information on phases: http://web.archive.org/web/20210326104758/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/vaccination-against-covid-19/when-is-it-my-turn     Information on stages of vaccination campaign in different regions: http://web.archive.org/web/20210326104641/https://www.krisinformation.se/detta-kan-handa/handelser-och-storningar/20192/myndigheterna-om-det-nya-coronaviruset/regional-information-om-coronaviruset     Type of vaccine: Pfizer, Moderna, AstraZeneca   - From 25 March, the use of AstraZeneca was continued for people over 65, but remained suspended for younger people: http://web.archive.org/web/20210326104151/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/nyheter-och-press/nyhetsarkiv/2021/mars/vaccinationerna-med-astra-zenecas-vaccin-kan-fortsatta-for-personer-som-ar-65-ar-och-aldre/   - The Janssen vaccin was approved on 11 March, but delivery to Sweden is expected only in April: http://web.archive.org/web/20210311192846/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/nyheter-och-press/nyhetsarkiv/2021/mars/fjarde-vaccinet-mot-covid-19-godkant/     Vaccinations are still taking place: http://web.archive.org/web/20210326104818/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/statistik-och-analyser/statistik-over-registrerade-vaccinationer-covid-19/

Most workplaces can open with special measures in place, but a number of workplaces are forced to close in relation to the ban on public gatherings of over 8 people, such as amusement parks and parades, and markets and fairs. As these sectors remain covered by the 8-people gathering limit, other rules re restriction of numbers of visitors, which apply to non-permanent amusement parks, zoos, museums, etc., do not apply.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210401150004/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/verksamheter/tillsynsvagledning-for-verksamheter/    Restaurants and cafés must be closed for consumption on site between 20.30 and 05.00. The size of a dining party allowed to sit at one table is limited to 4 people. If a party is larger than 8 people, they must be divided between several tables with at least one metre between them.     Shops, gym and sports facilities must calculate the number of visitors so that each person gets at least 10m². The maximum number of visitors is 500. They must have clear signs about how many are allowed to stay in the room at the same time.     Department stores and shops must take appropriate measures for people to visit the business one by one, without company. Shopping centres are an exception because they may house workplaces, care facilities and public transport services that cannot be accessed in any other way.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210401164449/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/restriktioner-och-forbud    http://web.archive.org/web/20210401164458/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/verksamheter/tillsynsvagledning-gallande-restauranger-och-krogar/

No change: public events have to be cancelled because of the ban on gatherings over 8 people.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210401164449/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/restriktioner-och-forbud

From 1 April, the national recommendation for upper secondary schools (gymnasieskolor) to partially conduct their education as distance education has been lifted. School principals can still decide to conduct distance education if necessary based on the local conditions, which will typically be reflected in regional recommendations such as the ones mentioned below.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210409192707/https://www.skolverket.se/regler-och-ansvar/coronaviruset-och-covid-19---regler-for-skolor-och-forskolor/coronaviruset---fragor-och-svar-utifran-skollagstiftningen    The regions of Dalarna and Kalmar län decided to extend the recommendation for partial distance education, but this policy is not framed in terms of possible full closures, and no schools in these regions appear fully closed, so this is coded as 1, no longer 2.   - Dalarna (up until week 15, 16 April ): http://web.archive.org/web/20210409193043/https://www.regiondalarna.se/press/nyheter-och-pressmeddelanden/smittskydd-dalarna-rekommendation-om-fortsatt-distansundervisning-i-dalarna/  - Kalmar län (until 30 April): http://web.archive.org/web/20210409192958/https://www.regionkalmar.se/nyhetslista/rekommendation-om-distansundervisning2/    In Västra Götaland, for gymnasieskolor, to teach students on site at least 20% of the time, but only allow 1/3 of students at a time (until 18 April): http://web.archive.org/web/20210409192800/https://www.vgregion.se/aktuellt/nyhetslista/regionala-rekommendationer-forlangs-till-18-april/

Shopping centres are an exception because they may house workplaces, care facilities and public transport services that cannot be accessed in any other way.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210409193454/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/restriktioner-och-forbud    http://web.archive.org/web/20210409193948/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/verksamheter/tillsynsvagledning-gallande-restauranger-och-krogar/

No change: public events have to be cancelled because of the ban on gatherings over 8 people.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210409193454/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/restriktioner-och-forbud

No change: The government has introduced a number of restrictions in connection with the pandemic law. Until further notice, no more than 8 people may be present at a public gathering or public event. The police has the right to cancel or dissolve an event that has more than 8 attendees. If a private gathering is held at an event venue, in a meeting room and at other rented premises, a maximum of eight people are allowed to attend. An exception is made for funerals, where up to 20 participants are allowed. If you organise an event in violation of the ban, you may face a fine or prison sentence of up to six months. Shops, gyms, indoor sports facilities, and swimming facilities must calculate the number of visitors so that each person is given ten square meters of space. The companies must display clear signage that clarifies for visitors how many people may visit the premises at the same time.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210409193454/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/restriktioner-och-forbud

No change: coded as 1 to reflect the recommendations 1) to the public to limit the use of public transport and forms of transport where you cannot book a designated seat as much as possible; 2) to public transport providers to alter their services in a way that limits the spread of the virus.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210409194047/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/skydda-dig-och-andra/om-du-planerar-att-resa/i-kollektivtrafiken/

The nation-wide recommendation for in-country travel is still: You have the personal responsibility to travel in a way that minimizes the spread of infection. ... Keep in mind that the spread of covid-19 is difficult to predict and can change in the place you travel to. Therefore, local restrictions may be imposed at short notice. It can affect your ability to travel home. If you need to stay away longer than planned, you may need to arrange accommodation during the extended stay and transport home.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210409194049/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/skydda-dig-och-andra/om-du-planerar-att-resa/     In several regions, stricter regional measures dictate to "avoid all unnecessary travel to, from and within the region". This applies to Stockholm, Södermanland, Uppsala, Västerbotten, Västmanland, Västra Götaland:  http://web.archive.org/web/20210409194209/https://www.krisinformation.se/detta-kan-handa/handelser-och-storningar/20192/myndigheterna-om-det-nya-coronaviruset/regional-information-om-coronaviruset

There is a ban on unnecessary travel to Sweden from countries outside the EU. The ban applies until 31 May 2021.  The entry ban does not apply to Swedish citizens or citizens of another EU / EEA country. Citizens of another EU / EEA country must present a maximum of 48 hours old negative covid-19 test. There are exceptions to the test requirement . Swedish citizens are recommended to test themselves after a stay abroad.  Swedish border inspectors decide how the exceptions are to be interpreted and what decisions are to be made. It is the traveler's own responsibility to be able to prove his right to an exception in border control. It is therefore necessary to be able to present, for example, employment certificates or extracts from the population register.     In addition, the following recommendation applies to everyone, including Swedes:   The Public Health Agency recommends everyone who travels into Sweden , regardless of citizenship, to test themselves upon entry and to avoid contacts for seven days. Five days after arriving from abroad, the traveler should take a second test. This applies regardless of whether you are covered by the requirement to present a negative covid-19 test before entry. Stay home for at least seven days. Avoid contact with others as much as possible. Test yourself as soon as possible after arrival in Sweden with a follow-up test after five days.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210409194247/https://www.krisinformation.se/detta-kan-handa/handelser-och-storningar/20192/myndigheterna-om-det-nya-coronaviruset/reseinformation-med-anledning-av-det-nya-coronaviruset

Testing is recommended to anyone over 6 years old with symptoms + recommended to people who have travelled from abroad. If you have previously had COVID-19 in the past half-year and this was confirmed through a PCR test, an antigen test or an antibody test, you do not need to be retested for COVID-19, unless a doctor determines that you need to do so. However, you should stay at home as long as you have symptoms.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210409194436/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/the-public-health-agency-of-sweden/communicable-disease-control/covid-19/covid-19-testing/    http://web.archive.org/web/20210409194247/https://www.krisinformation.se/detta-kan-handa/handelser-och-storningar/20192/myndigheterna-om-det-nya-coronaviruset/reseinformation-med-anledning-av-det-nya-coronaviruset

No change:   The regions of Örebro, Gävleborg, Halland, Norrbotten, Stockholm, Södermanland, Uppsala, Västerbotten, Västmanland, and Västra Götaland have introduced more extensive mask recommendations: the use of masks on public transport at all times, not only during rush hours, and when there is prolonged (15+ min) close contact with other people indoors.     This is coded as 2T to reflect the broader scope of application and stronger language ("must always be worn") of this recommendation compared to the national-level recommendation for rush hour mask use in public transport.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210409194209/https://www.krisinformation.se/detta-kan-handa/handelser-och-storningar/20192/myndigheterna-om-det-nya-coronaviruset/regional-information-om-coronaviruset

A,C:  Most regions are still in Phase 1:  "Phase 1: The first group to be offered vaccination will be those living in nursing homes or receiving home care, members of the same household and staff who work with them."  Several regions have entered Phase 2, which includes anyone 65+ (though implementation differs from region to region) as well as a few clinically vulnerable groups (B): adults receiving LSS interventions or assistance allowance, healthcare and care service personnel, people who have undergone bone marrow or other organ transplantation and people undergoing dialysis treatment. Information on which groups are included the different phases of the vaccination strategy.     Information on phases:  http://web.archive.org/web/20210409194539/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/vaccination-against-covid-19/when-is-it-my-turn     Information on stages of vaccination campaign in different regions:   http://web.archive.org/web/20210409194209/https://www.krisinformation.se/detta-kan-handa/handelser-och-storningar/20192/myndigheterna-om-det-nya-coronaviruset/regional-information-om-coronaviruset     Type of vaccine: Pfizer, Moderna, AstraZeneca  - From 25 March, the use of AstraZeneca was continued for people over 65, but remained suspended for younger people. The Public Health Agency is still interpreting EMA’s safety review after new information came out, but it announced on 8 April that in the process, its approach will remain to use AstraZeneca for people over 65 only: http://web.archive.org/web/20210409195713/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/nyheter-och-press/nyhetsarkiv/2021/april/bedomning-pagar-efter-utlatande-fran-europeiska-lakemedelsmyndigheten-ema/     - The Janssen vaccin was approved on 11 March, but delivery to Sweden is expected only in April: http://web.archive.org/web/20210311192846/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/nyheter-och-press/nyhetsarkiv/2021/mars/fjarde-vaccinet-mot-covid-19-godkant/     Vaccinations are still taking place:  http://web.archive.org/web/20210409194534/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/statistik-och-analyser/statistik-over-registrerade-vaccinationer-covid-19/

No change:  The general recommendations for visitors of elderly homes include: - Stay at home if you feel ill. Ask the staff about the procedures that apply at the care home you are visiting.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210409194854/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/publicerat-material/publikationsarkiv/p/prevent-the-spread-of-covid-19-when-visiting-care-homes-for-older-people/

Authorities in Uppsala speak of a “personal lockdown”, but the concrete recommendations are similar to in other regions:    “On Thursday [8 April], the region’s infectious disease doctor urged all Uppsala residents to “enter a personal lockdown” and “consider all human contacts as a potential risk [of Covid-19 infection].” The same messaging has appeared on posters and online adverts.  While this is a noticeably sharper tone, the actual recommendations in place in Uppsala remain the same, namely:  If you get symptoms, stay at home and get tested  Keep at least two metres’ distance from other people, both indoors and outdoors  Don’t spend time in busy indoor environments  Work from home if you can  If you have to use public transport, use a face mask  Don’t meet anyone you don’t live with”    http://web.archive.org/web/20210419201044/https://www.thelocal.se/20210413/how-is-uppsalas-personal-lockdown-different-from-the-rest-of-sweden/    http://web.archive.org/web/20210419201406/https://regionuppsala.se/det-har-gor-vi/vara-verksamheter/halso-och-sjukvard/information-om-coronaviruset/lokala-rekommendationer---covid-19/

On 8 April, the region of Uppsala announced it would give people who had already had Covid-19 a single dose of the vaccine, six months after infection: http://web.archive.org/web/20210409194714/https://www.thelocal.se/20210408/uppsala-to-offer-only-one-dose-of-vaccine-to-people-who-have-had-covid-19/

On 9 April, Uppsala reversed its decision to only give previously infected people only 1 dose of the vaccine: http://web.archive.org/web/20210409194722/https://www.thelocal.se/20210409/swedish-region-makes-u-turn-on-new-covid-19-vaccination-rules/

From 1 April, the national recommendation for upper secondary schools (gymnasieskolor) to partially conduct their education as distance education has been lifted. School principals can still decide to conduct distance education if necessary based on the local conditions, which will typically be reflected in regional recommendations such as the ones mentioned below.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210419185721/https://www.skolverket.se/regler-och-ansvar/coronaviruset-och-covid-19---regler-for-skolor-och-forskolor/coronaviruset---fragor-och-svar-utifran-skollagstiftningen    The regions of Dalarna and Kalmar län decided to extend the recommendation for partial distance education, but this policy is not framed in terms of possible full closures, and no schools in these regions appear fully closed, so this is coded as 1, no longer 2.   - Blekinge: https://web.archive.org/web/20210419193822/https://www.1177.se/blekinge/allmanna-rad-och-regler-covid-19  - Dalarna (up until week 15, i.e. 16 April): http://web.archive.org/web/20210409193043/https://www.regiondalarna.se/press/nyheter-och-pressmeddelanden/smittskydd-dalarna-rekommendation-om-fortsatt-distansundervisning-i-dalarna/  - Kalmar län (until 30 April): http://web.archive.org/web/20210419190853/https://www.regionkalmar.se/nyhetslista/rekommendation-om-distansundervisning2/    In Västra Götaland, for gymnasieskolor, to teach students on site at least 20% of the time, but only allow 1/3 of students at a time (extended until 2 May): http://web.archive.org/web/20210419190918/https://www.vgregion.se/aktuellt/nyhetslista/regionala-rekommendationer/

No change, measures for shops, restaurants etc. in place until at least 2 May:     Most workplaces can open with special measures in place, but a number of workplaces are forced to close in relation to the ban on public gatherings of over 8 people, such as fairground amusements and parades, and markets and fairs. As amusement parks of a permanent nature ('stadigvarande tivolinöje') remain covered by the 8-people gathering limit, other rules re restriction of numbers of visitors, which apply to non-permanent amusement parks, zoos, museums, etc., do not apply.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210419191702/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/verksamheter/tillsynsvagledning-for-verksamheter/     Between 1 March and 2 May, restaurants and cafés must be closed for consumption on site between 20.30 and 05.00. The size of a dining party allowed to sit at one table is limited to 4 people. If a party is larger than 8 people, they must be divided between several tables with at least one metre between them.     Shops, gym and sports facilities must calculate the number of visitors so that each person gets at least 10m². The maximum number of visitors is 500. They must have clear signs about how many are allowed to stay in the room at the same time.     Department stores and shops must take appropriate measures for people to visit the business one by one, without company. Shopping centres are an exception because they may house workplaces, care facilities and public transport services that cannot be accessed in any other way.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210412224247/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/restriktioner-och-forbud     http://web.archive.org/web/20210419191702/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/verksamheter/tillsynsvagledning-for-verksamheter/

***Recoded from 3G to 2G. Not all areas are vaccinating all three groups. Since this indicator is coded to the lowest national standard (rather than the highest targeted measure) 2G better reflects the national baseline for vaccination.     See previous coding note:     A,B,C:  Almost all regions are now in phase 2, a few still in phase 1, and Kalmar is the first region to have entered phase 3.     Phase 1: The first group to be offered vaccination will be those living in nursing homes or receiving home care, members of the same household and staff who work with them.  Several regions have entered Phase 2, which includes anyone 65+ (though implementation differs from region to region) as well as a few clinically vulnerable groups (B): adults receiving LSS interventions or assistance allowance, healthcare and care service personnel, people who have undergone bone marrow or other organ transplantation and people undergoing dialysis treatment. Information on which groups are included the different phases of the vaccination strategy.  Phase 3 in Kalmar initially means everyone over 60, and later will also include over-18s who have certain underlying health conditions, including chronic heart, lung, liver or kidney disease, severe asthma, diabetes, health conditions that cause impaired lung functioning (for example extreme obesity, neuromuscular diseases or multiple disabilities), Down syndrome, or people with a severely weakened immune system due to illness or ongoing medical treatment.     Information on phases:  http://web.archive.org/web/20210419192822/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/vaccination-against-covid-19/when-is-it-my-turn     Information on stages of vaccination campaign in different regions:   - http://web.archive.org/web/20210419200401/https://www.thelocal.se/20210414/where-is-the-vaccination-programme-up-to-in-swedens-21-regions/  - http://web.archive.org/web/20210419194247/https://www.krisinformation.se/detta-kan-handa/handelser-och-storningar/20192/myndigheterna-om-det-nya-coronaviruset/regional-information-om-coronaviruset  - Kalmar press release: http://web.archive.org/web/20210419200726/https://www.regionkalmar.se/nyhetslista/60-64-aringar-kan-boka-vaccination/     Type of vaccine: Pfizer, Moderna, AstraZeneca  - From 25 March, the use of AstraZeneca was continued for people over 65, but remained suspended for younger people: http://web.archive.org/web/20210326104151/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/nyheter-och-press/nyhetsarkiv/2021/mars/vaccinationerna-med-astra-zenecas-vaccin-kan-fortsatta-for-personer-som-ar-65-ar-och-aldre/  - Re Janssen: The American manufacturer has suspended deliveries of Janssen's vaccine to Europe. To date, 31,000 doses have arrived in Sweden, but none have been distributed for vaccination. The Swedish Public Health Agency is now awaiting the results of the EMA's ongoing safety investigation. Until then, the recommendation is not to use the vaccine doses: http://web.archive.org/web/20210419193234/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/nyheter-och-press/nyhetsarkiv/2021/april/janssens-vaccin-pausas-i-vantan-pa-utredning-fran-ema/     Vaccinations are still taking place:  http://web.archive.org/web/20210419192826/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/statistik-och-analyser/statistik-over-registrerade-vaccinationer-covid-19/

The general recommendations for visitors of elderly homes include: - Stay at home if you feel ill.
